page.title: 06LLANSTEFFAN AREA: INFLUENCES
page.content: The past has left its marks on our landscape and heritage. Ystyffan was a Celtic saint, Teilo's bard, descended from Vortigern and from Magnus Maximus and Elin.The Castle recalls the Norman invader. Llanybri derives from Llan Olbri and Ffynnon Olbri, perhaps Oliver's church and well. Dylan Thomas often spoke about Llanybri and Llansteffan in his poetry and prose. The indigenous population mostly have Welsh as their first language and are bi-lingual. Welsh is the language of the chapels, English of Llansteffan Church whilst Llanybri Church is bi-lingual. Often inhabitants are mostly monoglot English speaking. It's not always peaceful here. Pembrey bombing range, low flying RAF training aircraft and explosions from the MoD range across the Taf often deafen and alarm.
